content: Karl Rove is planting the idea that Pelosi is “an accessory to a crime of torture” in an op-ed piece in the Wall Street Journal. >http://online.wsj.com/article/SB124226863721018193.html< If Rove is implicating Pelosi in the crime of torture, then the crime of torture had to be committed. That crime of torture would have been committed by the Bush Administration. In their zeal to go after Pelosi, the Republicans seem to be implicating the Bush Administration of wrong doing. Lying to the public is not a crime. Covering up a crime is. So what is she guilty of?

content: You are correct, it is a great political plan, and the Republicans are falling right into it. The Republicans are going after Pelosi would be exactly what President Obama would want. She is too far left and has got in the way of several Obama proposals. The Republicans (and many independence like me) may not like Pelosi, but if she is out and Steny Hoyer becomes Speaker, the Obama Administration will be able to move even more of its agenda though Congress. The Republicans are focusing on petty things like Pelosi lying to the American public and stirring up the base with fear tactics like “Obama is going to release terrorists into the United States and give them welfare” (which is a lie) because they have no real leadership. Meanwhile, President Obama is building a “new foundation” for the country and Republicans are clueless about how to be effective counterweights like they should be.

content: This is the best assesment of the situation I have seen so far. The briefing sessions by the CIA were held for key congressional leaders beginning in the fall of 2002. They were non-controversial then because Democrats along with Republicans wanted to avoid looking soft on terrorists. With few exceptions, those who attended the meetings say the CIA was above-board about water-boarding. Those who maintain the agency wasn’t are very-very weak about it and are doing so likely to spare Pelosi disaster: Sen. Jay Rockefeller (D-WV) and ex-Sen. Bob Graham (D-Fla.) "http://www.cdobs.com/archive/featured/pelosi-on-ropes-will-she-take-a-fall,22796"

content: quote: Originally posted by A_Savage: So Karl Rove does admit it was torture then -- and we violated treaties we wrote and signed -- interesting --Savage I took it as though he was saying, if Nancy Pelosi is going to try and charge folks, that she would be guilty as well. I don't think he admitted it was torture. I don't agree though, I think waterboarding is a form of torture and I think we need a new doctrine to supercede the GC. The GC is not specific enough, therefore the Bush Admin were able to find a loophole. Todays politics remind me of an old saying. - "Ideas are more powerful than guns. We would not let our enemies have guns, why should we let them have ideas?" - Joseph Stalin
